While playing Half-Life 2, you can clearly tell why and how it has had such a massive influence on the contemporary FPS titles. Even last year's massively successful Doom Eternal shares certain gameplay elements similar to HL2 Episode 1, which was released nearly 15 years ago. In spite of being this old, HL 2 and its episodic contents, in my opinion, still looks good and feels fresh, especially if a player is playing these games for the first time. This is perhaps due to the overall polish of these games, yes these are very well polished games. The physics, the realistic water reflections of the Source engine, the environment, the sound design and the combat are some of the biggest highlights of this game. Sure, there are some elements which haven't aged that well; the driving mechanics and the AI feels a bit janky by today's standards, but considering that HL2 was one of the pioneers in introducing these technologies into the modern gaming scene, the dated aspects can be excused and simply made the best use of. From a narrative standpoint, this game excels highly at three things: character development, environmental storytelling and the overall feel. The exposition is for the players to decode; starting from the newspaper clippings and the graffiti on the walls surrounding the desolate streets of City 17, to the body language of the oppressed citizens expressing helplessness, all these details presented around the player echoes a much larger story of the wreckage of an entire civilization, caused by the events set in motion following HL 1. The NPCs are fully fleshed out with discrete motivation which serves the plot really well. The sound design and the soundtrack only adds to the ominous atmosphere prevailing from one level to another. Furthermore, the level design is one of the strongest aspects of HL2 and its episodes, with each level having its own distinct flavour and memorable moments. In contrast to HL1 which feels more like a survival horror game first and a sci-fi game later, HL2 and its episodes seem to strike a perfect balance between sci-fi, horror, adventure and some epic action, which is apparent from its increased scope, complex narrative elements, and the capabilities of Source engine to support this method of storytelling. All in all, if you're hesitant about playing this game because its old, do not think twice and just go for it, for it will surely become one of the best FPS single player campaigns you will ever experience. I wish that Valve adds the much awaited "third" title to this masterful series of games soon, especially now that they have Source 2 in their hands and with the success of Half-Life: Alyx, the chances are much stronger. Be that as it may, I hope it won't be a VR exclusive product.

Есть карточки. Есть атмосфера,сюжет про захват инопланетянами земли и порабощение землян с целью изничтожить человечество, запрещено размножаться. Везде снуют роботы-убийцы летающие и наблюдающие. Полицаи из числа людей на каждом шагу. Не забываемый сюжет и стимул к поиску свободы, философии жизни, разуму и размышлениям как жить. На момент выхода первой части игра была слишком уникальна и завораживала. Стиль игры выживание в мире апокалипсиса и рабства. 
Оценка игры: 10 из 10.
Категория игры: Семейная. Есть жестокость и убийства.

Немой дед, с турбодвигателями на ногах, подкидывающие тебя за три девять земель на чай к царю. Хорошо что физика хф позволяет тебе улететь в стратосферу и при полете обратно, попав в маленькую лужу, которую создала собака у столба, не только остаться живым, но еще твое тело будет цело, а не одна нога в Алекс, а другая у доктора Брина в сейфе под замком. 10 работающих на батарейках Фрименов из 10

Dis game is kewl

This is the greatest valve game I have ever played. It takes the creativity of portal and applies it to the fast paced genre of first person shooting. The game pushes you along using its quick tempo drum and bass soundtrack which always kicks in at the most suspenseful moments.  The sound design in this game is incredible. The arsenal of weapons Gordon Freeman has at his disposal is what really makes this experience unforgettable. So much time is spent toying with the gravity gun and crowbar-ing everything in sight. Almost every object has its own physics and weight,  A truly unique experience that only Valve could muster up.  I'm disappointed in myself for not playing this sooner.
